snippet: President Obama’s visit to Afghanistan for the first time in 17 months was a chance to make the most of a brief window when relations between the two governments are improving after months of crisis.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama's visit to Afghanistan for the first time in 17 months makes the most of a brief window when relations between the two governments are improving after months of crisis, and fallout from the NATO withdrawal is still months away; in the background, however, there are concerns about how things could go once the troops are gone and the aid money slows.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s visit to Afghanistan for the first time in 17 months was a chance to make the most of a brief window when relations between the two governments are improving after months of crisis.

headline.seo: President Obama’s Visit to Afghanistan Is a Chance to Ease Tensions
headline.main: A Visit Well Timed to Future Uncertainties in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: A Visit Well Timed to Future Uncertainties in Afghanistan
